channel.title: A good, decent starter kit
channel.description: What do you guys think could be a good starter kit that is economically friendly?

item.title: A good, decent starter kit
item.dc:creator: @KempiScape KempiScape
item.description:
@KempiScape wrote:

[quote=“TimeRS3, post:19, topic:518091”]if you make 667 or 718 your better of doing

  • 500k
  • monk robes
  • spells for just the first air spell
  • abyssal whip
  • free SOF spin (if you have)
  • rules book
  • bow and arrows
  • and just to be nice put in a random box.
  • ava’s[/quote] Instead of whip i would pick a dragon scimitar as whip requires a slayer level to obtain, making abby demon ask useless

Read full topic

item.title: A good, decent starter kit
item.dc:creator: @MicroZoft MicroZoft
item.description:
@MicroZoft wrote:

I give simply 200k cash for first login on IP 100k for the second. With the prices changed in the different tier shops I have that should allow you to get the basic needs whatever you decide to train. Anything over 1M is too much really.

Read full topic

item.title: A good, decent starter kit
item.dc:creator: @Elrick Elrick
item.description:
@Elrick wrote:

Ashley:

The original starting items of RuneScape.

This, but give slightly more runes. Or maybe just an Air staff, as it is a rudimentary item to have for the magic skill and is not over powered for starters.

Read full topic

item.title: A good, decent starter kit
item.dc:creator: @TimeRS3 TimeRS3
item.description:
@TimeRS3 wrote:

best possible you could go with depending on which revision if your doing a 317 forget it easy money make your starter

  • 1M
  • Iron Armour set
  • scimitars
  • whip
  • runes for the 4 basic attack spells

im not good with 562 so I’m not really sure how you would make that really depends what base you make it pk or ECO all around.

if you make 667 or 718 your better of doing

  • 500k
  • monk robes
  • spells for just the first air spell
  • abyssal whip
  • free SOF spin (if you have)
  • rules book
  • bow and arrows
  • and just to be nice put in a random box.
  • ava’s

Read full topic

item.title: A good, decent starter kit
item.dc:creator: @Tutorial Tutorial
item.description:
@Tutorial wrote:

[quote=“Int Bauk, post:10, topic:518091”][quote author=amy_webb link=topic=636356.msg4290993#msg4290993 date=1367230865]
Is the server skill based or pk based?
[/quote]

what does it matter? either way it has to be economically friendly.

ot- basic supplies: runes, arrows, bow, and some form of weapon. maybe minimal coins, 10k if that?[/quote]
Not necessarily, because a lot of people player servers just to pk, and they could care less about the economy.

Read full topic

item.title: A good, decent starter kit
item.dc:creator: @amy_webb1 amy_webb
item.description:
@amy_webb1 wrote:

[quote=“Int Bauk, post:10, topic:518091”][quote author=amy_webb link=topic=636356.msg4290993#msg4290993 date=1367230865]
Is the server skill based or pk based?
[/quote]

what does it matter? either way it has to be economically friendly.

ot- basic supplies: runes, arrows, bow, and some form of weapon. maybe minimal coins, 10k if that?[/quote]
It does matter, if it is pk based then you give them weapons as a starter, but if it is skill based you give them basic tools as the starter. It just depends on how you want your server to run and how everything is laid out.

Read full topic

item.title: A good, decent starter kit
item.dc:creator: @sinisoul sini
item.description:
@sinisoul wrote:

You want to give them the basics so that the economy can grow, obviously. Take for instance when the oldschool servers opened, the economy was non existent for weeks because people had absolutely nothing. No matter what you will have that platform, the difficult part then was getting enough cash to buy weapons to get more cash into the economy which was a huge pain. I remember waiting HOURS to get a rune longsword on release. It was painful, and since this is a private server it’d take even longer because you have less people to help. Excuse the tangent, but, point being give them something to work with that helps them buy good armour to start out with (steel/mithril) because then your economy base will grow much faster then giving them nothing at all.

Read full topic

item.title: A good, decent starter kit
item.dc:creator: @Int_Bauk Int Bauk
item.description:
@Int_Bauk wrote:

[quote=“Kidpaparoach, post:11, topic:518091”][quote author=Int Bauk link=topic=636356.msg4291062#msg4291062 date=1367248660]

Is the server skill based or pk based?

what does it matter? either way it has to be economically friendly.

ot- basic supplies: runes, arrows, bow, and some form of weapon. maybe minimal coins, 10k if that?
[/quote]
Are you going to give uncooked trout in a starter pack in a pking server where you can’t skill and the value is next to nothing?[/quote]

why not?

item.title: A good, decent starter kit
item.dc:creator: @Cruel_Truth Cruel Truth
item.description:
@Cruel_Truth wrote:

Nothing

[hr]

Considering the rarity that you will get a REAL “first time rsps player” (it does happen though…)then you should always consider the fact everyone will have a general idea already how to make money.

Let them go thieve or whatever it takes.

item.title: A good, decent starter kit
item.dc:creator: @silabsoft RuneAgent
item.description:
@silabsoft wrote:

you should never give much for starting items, chances are your server has the player interacts directly with the live world as soon as the account is created (no tutorial) so if you give enough value to a player that starts it will tempt players to just create accounts and mule the items.

Read full topic
